intro: Asyneuma asperum, commonly known as rough asyneuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features rough, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Asyneuma asperum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
